edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.io

Class CourseRecordIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.io.CourseRecordIO

  • public class CourseRecordIO
extends java.lang.Object
    Reads Course records from text files. Writes a set of CourseRecords to a file.
    Author:
    Sarah Heckman, William

    • Method Detail

      • readCourseRecords

        public static edu.ncsu.csc216.collections.list.SortedList<Course> readCourseRecords(java.lang.String fileName)
                                                                             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads course records from a file and generates a list of valid Courses. Any invalid Courses are ignored. If the file to read cannot be found or the permissions are incorrect a File NotFoundException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file to read Course records from
        Returns:
        a list of valid Courses
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found or read

      • writeCourseRecords

        public static void writeCourseRecords(java.lang.String fileName,
                                      edu.ncsu.csc216.collections.list.SortedList<Course> courses)
                               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Writes the given list of Courses to a file The IOException has been caught in the WolfScheduler class
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the file to which the files will be written
        courses - courses to be written to the file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - thrown if the file of filename cannot be found (this is thrown by wolfScheduler class)
